alert.note: Alert for Northern Wayne; Pike; Southern Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 3:45AM EST until March 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 7 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph late this afternoon through tonight. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Southern Wayne, Pike and Northern Wayne counties. In New York, Sullivan, Otsego and Delaware counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility. Near blizzard conditions are possible at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow could produce snowfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour for a time between 8 AM and 2 PM today. The steady snow will taper off to snow showers with continued blowing snow by late this afternoon or early evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorist to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
